replies.body:
Given that in the 14-day ban reform card it is explicitly stated that "If [your] behaviour continues, your account will be permanently suspended", and that there are 3 games worth of chat logs here, I ask you, what makes this time different? The permanent suspension should have been no surprise.

What I can tell you, is that punishments will never be removed or reduced unless they are made in error. A permanent suspension is permanent, and there is no way for you to recover this account. While I commend the decision to reform, it is too late for this account, though you aren't in any way restricted from creating a new one.

Still, if you'd like to appeal through official channels you can do so through player support, but I wouldn't be getting your hopes up.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new
Given I had an account perma for me ranting about voip software being rubbish in chat, I wouldn't expect much... Never been warned before either...

The system cannot apply a permanent suspension to an account for behaviour without at least one 14-day ban being applied first. The only things that will get you an instant perma are things like cheating, chargebacks and bought accounts.

Without knowing exactly why you were punished there isn't much more I can give you. If you want, I'd encourage you to create your own thread with your reform card and we can discuss from there.
Well it did, and I appealed via ticket support a number of times...
Like I said, without the context (the reform card), there isn't any specific info anyone can give you.

Nah, it's 2 years old, I've moved on and reformed.

No I brought it up because someone with a similar incident has been banned. I also know you can be perma for a rant (skipping a 14 day suspension)
You can't skip the 14-day suspension, and couldn't 2 years ago.

Yes but it's those particular situations that are important. If you cheated or used scripts, then yes, you can be instant perma-banned. These aren't manual punishments, but it *is* a different part of the system. 

If you issue a charge-back you can be instant perma-banned, and again it is an automatic process, but not related to gameplay or chat which you said your punishment was for.

If your account is found to have been bought, then you can be instant perma-banned. As for auto or manual, I don't know, that process is intentionally obfuscated.

For gameplay or chat punishments, you have to have received at least a 14-day ban before being issued a permanent suspension first. 

That's not to say exceptions are impossible, but we're talking things like serious threats, or other things that would be "escalate to local authorities" worthy. The average toxic player (nevermind the average player) will never encounter those.

The automated system physically can't skip that tier, so unless you weren't cheating and didn't chargeback or buy your account (which I already explained were the exceptions), it would take some *very* extenuating circumstances and a manual punishment to do so.

Keep in mind the IFS can issue punishments independently, without priorly escalating them first. (ex. You can get a permanent ban without receiving 1 single chat restriction).

I apologize if the first reply was in any way confusing. Also, we do not have a 21 days suspension, but a 2-week ban. However, it is not mandatory - players can receive a permanent suspension even if there are no previous restrictions in some particular cases. While there is indeed a common punishment escalation(2 chat restriction, a 2-week ban and ultimately a permanent one), please note that some punishments can be "skipped", depending on the situation.
